issue.title: [DocDB] Geo: Add support for finer-grain levels of locality

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: This is an enhancement of an existing feature

repository.name: yugabyte-db
repository.description: YugabyteDB - the cloud native distributed SQL database for mission-critical applications.

issue.body:
Jira Link: [DB-922](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-922)
### Description

Context: #9980 

We currently only support _global_ and _region-local_ transactions. This means that if we have a cluster spanning much of the globe (e.g. nodes in the US, EU, and Asia Pacific), and have `tablespace_us` spanning multiple regions within the US, distributed transactions to write to tables under `tablespace_us` (replicated solely within the US) will incur global latencies at commit time due to the use of the global transaction table.

To support this case, we introduce the concept of _tablespace-local_(TABLESPACE) localities. Transactions with _tablespace-local_(tablespaceA) locality will use transaction status tablets that follow tablespaceA placement, and can write to tables under tablespaceA.

In the example above, a transaction writing to the table that replicates over multiple US regions (and thus would be under a tablespace with placement spanning those US regions) would be _tablespace-local_(tablespace\_us) and thus commits will only incur the latency of replicating across US regions, rather than the entire globe.

This issue tracks all the changes required to support _tablespace-local_ localities. The feature is scoped under runtime tserver gflag - `use_tablespace_based_transaction_placement`. #28604 adds GUC for using tablespace-local method.

**Performance Regression**: It is possible to encounter performance regressions in certain setups with tablespace-local transaction tables. Consider a cluster with a RF3 tablespace SingleAZ replicated in US-East-1a (single AZ), and a RF3 tablespace MultiAZ replicated over US-East-1a/US-East-1b/US-East-1c (multi AZ, single region).

Under the previous category system, a transaction that first writes to a table in SingleAZ is started as region-local. If it then proceeds to write to a table in MultiAZ, it remains region-local, since the second write is still within the local region.

Under the tablespace-local category system, a transaction that first writes to a table in SingleAZ is started as tablespace-local(SingleAZ). If it then proceeds to write to a table in MultiAZ, it must be promoted to global, since we do not support promotion to tablespace-local(MultiAZ). #28273 tracks this.

Additionally, a transaction that first writes to a table in MultiAZ is started as tablespace-local(MultiAZ). If it then proceeds to write to a table in SingleAZ, it also must be promoted to global, since we will initially only do strict equality checks on tablespace id. #28272 track this.


Internal doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nOtJQSiHqLrFsj8WVeDeffIAsRNuzJypVMmEOhamfUs

**Base Feature**
- [x] #28269
- [x] #28270
- [x] #28273 
- [x] #28604 

**Additional Improvements**
- [x] #28272
- [x] #28317 
- [ ] #28271 


**Optional Improvements**
- [ ] #28486

issue.title: [DocDB] Disable table-level locks for geo-partitioning tests failing due to #28317

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: This is an enhancement of an existing feature

repository.name: yugabyte-db
repository.description: YugabyteDB - the cloud native distributed SQL database for mission-critical applications.

issue.body:
Jira Link: [DB-18485](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-18485)
### Description

A handful of geo-partitioning tests explicitly test when transactions are not started
as region-local. This fails when table-level locks are enabled due to #28317. These should 
disable table-level locks until #28317 is fixed.
- GeoTransactionsTest.TestTransactionTabletSelection
- GeoTransactionsTest.TestTransactionTabletSelectionWildcard
- GeoTransactionsTest.TestAutomaticLocalTransactionTableCreation
- GeoTransactionsTablespaceLocalityTest.TestSimple
- GeoTransactionsTablespaceLocalityTest.TestFK
- GeoTransactionsTablespaceLocalityTest.TestAlterSetTablespace

### Issue Type

kind/failing-test

### Warning: Please confirm that this issue does not contain any sensitive information

- [x] I confirm this issue does not contain any sensitive information.

issue.title: [DocDB] GeoTransactionPromotionTests failing with table-level locks due to docdb transaction for read

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: This is an enhancement of an existing feature

repository.name: yugabyte-db
repository.description: YugabyteDB - the cloud native distributed SQL database for mission-critical applications.

issue.body:
Jira Link: [DB-18528](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-18528)
### Description

A handful of GeoTransactionPromotionTests tests:
- GeoTransactionsPromotion.TestOldRegionFailBeforeAbortSentEarly
- GeoTransactionsPromotion.TestOldRegionFailBeforeRPCSend
- GeoTransactionsPromotion.TestOldRegionFailAfterRPCBeforeAbortSentEarly

fail when enable_object_locking_for_table_locks is on. This is because all three tests do the following:
1. initiate a transaction promotion
2. shutdown tserver hosting transaction tablet
3. run select on data

(3) worked fine when enable_object_locking_for_table_locks is off, since no docdb transaction is used. But with enable_object_locking_for_table_locks on, we now start a docdb transaction for this read, and this is started as region-local (related #28317). But the region-local transaction tablets are all on the shutdown tserver, so this gets stuck.

### Issue Type

kind/failing-test

### Warning: Please confirm that this issue does not contain any sensitive information

- [x] I confirm this issue does not contain any sensitive information.

[DB-18528]: https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-18528?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

issue.title: [DocDB] Geo: Perform initial is-region-local checks on tserver side

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: This is an enhancement of an existing feature

repository.name: yugabyte-db
repository.description: YugabyteDB - the cloud native distributed SQL database for mission-critical applications.

issue.body:
Jira Link: [DB-18538](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-18538)
### Description

With the changes from #28269 and #28270, we now have both tablespace oid in Perform requests and tablespace information on the tserver. The initial is-region-local determination used for whether we start a transaction as region-local/global can be moved to the tserver side. This also allows for a cleaner fix of #28317.

### Issue Type

kind/enhancement
